2. When driving on slick roads, drivers should:

column2: 3. The first sign drivers see when approaching a highway-rail intersection is usually:

column10: You must yield the right-of-way ahead

column2: 6. Before passing another vehicle, you should signal:
column6: early enough so other drivers know your intention.

column2: 7. A flashing yellow light means:
8. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: approach the turn in the right lane or from the right side of a single lane.

column8: approach the turn in the left lane or from the left side of a single lane.

column2: 9. What is the most important rule to remember in any emergency?

12. A traffic sign with a red circle around and a slash over a symbol means:
column4: the maneuver shown on the sign can be executed only after coming to a complete stop.
column6: Do not drive faster than the posted speed limit.
column8: the maneuver shown on the sign should be executed with extreme caution.
column10: the maneuver shown by the symbol is not allowed.

column2: 13. What does a flashing red light mean?
column4: Drivers may move forward with caution.
column10: The same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 14. This sign means:
column4: Left turns in both directions of travel are not permitted.
column8: The center lane is shared for left turns.

column2: 15. To avoid having to make an emergency stop while driving in traffic, drivers should:
column4: sound their horn to warn other drivers.
column6: drive slower than the flow of traffic.
column8: drive in the right lane only.
column10: look ahead and maintain a safe following distance.

column2: 16. You may park or stop along the shoulder of the freeway:
column4: if no part of your vehicle is on the road.
column6: if you need to check your smartphone for directions.
column8: only if you have an emergency.
column10: as long as you turn on your emergency flashers.

column2: 17. One broken line indicates:
column4: You can pass other vehicles and change lanes, if it is safe.
column6: You can change lanes, but only when traffic conditions or obstructions in the road make it necessary.
column8: You can not pass other vehicles or go across the line.

column6: change lanes before you check for vehicles behind you.

29. A flashing red light:

column4: increase their speed to cross the intersection before a train arrives.
column6: slow down, look for a train, and be prepared to stop.
column8: come to a complete stop and wait for a train to cross.

column2: 38. In case of skidding, drivers should NOT:
column4: steer the car into the direction of the skid.
column6: pump the brakes gently if they are about to hit something.
column8: take their foot off the gas pedal.

column2: 39. __________ limit(s) your concentration, perception, judgment, and memory.
column4: Only a blood alcohol level greater than the legal limit
column6: Even the smallest amount of alcohol
column8: Only a blood alcohol level greater than .05

column2: 40. At intersections where two or more drivers stop at STOP signs at the same time and they are at right angles:
column4: the driver who is late for work has the right-of-way.
column6: the driver on the right must yield to the driver on the left.
column8: the driver who was going faster before stopping must yield.
column10: the driver on the left must yield to the driver on the right.
